header.title: Introduction

chapter.p: The Megaco application is a framework for building applications on top of the Megaco/H.248 protocol.

Megaco/H.248 is a protocol for control of elements in a physically decomposed multimedia gateway, enabling separation of call control from media conversion. A Media Gateway Controller (MGC) controls one or more Media Gateways (MGs).
This version of the stack supports version 1, 2, and 3 as defined by:

item.p: prev3a - as defined by TD-33 (except segments)
prev3b - TD-33 updated to be backward compatible with v2 (except segments)
prev3c - As defined by ITU H.248.1 (09/2005) (except segments)
v3 - Full version 3 as defined by ITU H.248.1 (09/2005) (including segments)

chapter.p: The semantics of the protocol has jointly been defined by two standardization bodies:

list.item: IETF, which calls the protocol Megaco
ITU, which calls the protocol H.248

section.title: Scope and Purpose
section.p: This manual describes the Megaco application as a component of the Erlang/OTP development environment.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: It is assumed that the reader is familiar with the following:

list.item: Basics of the Abstract Syntax Notation One (ASN.1)
The Erlang Development Environment, which is described in a separate User's Guide

section.p: This application requires Erlang/OTP R10B or later.

section.title: About This Manual
section.p: This User's Guide is organized as follows:

item.p: Section 2, "Architecture", describes the architecture and typical usage of the application.
Section 3, "Running the Stack", describes start, the MGC startup call flow, the MG startup call flow, configuration, the transaction sender, and segmentation of transaction replies.
Section 4, "Internal Form and its Encodings", describes the internal form of Megaco/H.248 messages and its various encodings.
Section 5, "Transport Mechanisms", describes how different mechanisms can be used to transport the Megaco/H.248 messages.
Section 6, "Implementation Examples", provides examples of a simple MGC and a simple MG.
Section 7, "Megaco MIB", describes the Megaco MIB.
Section 8, "Performance Comparison", specifies system performance characteristics and describes encoders/decoders.
Section 9, "Testing and Tools", describes tracing and tools.

section.title: Where to Find More Information
section.p: For more information about Megaco/H.248 and the Erlang/OTP development system:
